Property destruction: On 17 Dec, three NATO containers were carrying goods for NATO forces stationed in Afghanistan were on their way from Karachi to Chaman when unknown armed men riding on motorcycle opened fire on the containers. Consequently, fire erupted in all the containers and cargo was destroyed.

Property destruction: On December 25, unknown armed men set ablaze the office of the Pakistan Tehreek-e-Insaf (PTI) in tehsil Taunsa Sharif of Dera Ghazi Khan (Punjab). The armed men sprinkled petrol and burnt everything inside.

ACTOR1: Police Forces of Pakistan (2008-2013) Pakistan Rangers
NOTES: Pakistani border officials arrested three Iranian border security guards on Jan 1, who have killed a Pakistani man the same day in Mazan Sar Mashkail in the Washuk district in Kalat of Balochistan.
Two militants were killed, when their explosive vest detonated accidentally in the Gorali village of Gujrat on Jan 3.
Due to security concerns, the Sindh Government banned all rallies and political activities in the 'red zone' of Karachi on Jan 4.
Two militants were killed accidentally by their own explosives on Jan 22 in the Zakakhel Banjwal area of Khyber Agency of FATA.
Baloch Republican Army militants destroyed a main gas supply pipeline on Jan 22 in the Mullguzar area of Quetta of Balochistan.

Arrests: On February 4, four alleged members of the Tehreek-e-Taliban, including the commander, Mullah Hakeem, responsible for over 100 bomb attacks on schools in Swat, were arrested in a raid carried out by an intelligence agency in Toori Bangash Colony, Orangi Town in Karachi city (Sindh). The commander was caught on a tip-off from TTP men.
As reported on Feb 15, the Halimzai Peace Committee has formed an armed lashkar in Ghalanai, Halimzai of the Mohmand Agency of FATA to fight against militants.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: Property destruction: On February 25, a US drone crashed in the Miranshah area (FATA), and was salvaged by TTP militants.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: Interception: A US drone crashed in the Mir Ali area in North Waziristan on Saturday [25 February] and the local Taleban immediately claimed responsibility for bringing it down.

On 8 March, the Police Forces arrested the three widows of Bin Laden on March 08 for being in Pakistan illegally. The TTP demanded release of the women. They threaten to attack several security forces, if the government fails to do so.

ASSOC_ACTOR_2: AHF: Al Harmain Foundation; RT: Rabita Trust
NOTES: The Government of Pakistan banned three religious/charity organizations on March 11: ASWJ: Ahle Sunnat Wal Jamaat; AHF: Al Harimain Foundation and RT: Rabita Trust.
After kidnapping 3 officials and a Levies soldier on March 07, 36 Bettani tribesmen were arrested in Lakki Marwat of Pakhtunkhwa on March 12.
Police Forces of Pakistan defused a bomb-laden vehicle on March 12 in the Chamkani area of Peshawar in Khyber Pakhtunkhwa.
90 suspected militants have been arrested in Yousef Talab, Jansi, Speen Qabar and Mandai Kas areas in the Bara Tehsil of Khyber Agency in FATA on March 15.

ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Refugees/IDPs (Pakistan)
NOTES: After the Military Forces of Pakistan started an operation against militants in the Malikdinkhel, Sipah, Qamarkhel and Akakhel areas of Bara in Khyber Agency of FATA, around 5,300 families left their homes from March 19 to 20. They arrived at the Jalozai relief camp.
8 militants were killed by their own explosives on March 24 in the Bara Akakhel area of Khyber Agency in FATA.

Property destruction: Unknown men opened indiscriminate fire and damaged furniture and other stuff inside the sector office of MQM in Tando Mohammed Khan late on Wednesday night however, no loss of life or injury has been reported in the attack.

ACTOR1: Police Forces of India (2004-2014) Border Security Force
NOTES: Arrests: Indian Naval forces stormed a Pakistani fishing boat and arrested four Pakistani fishermen after resorting to aerial firing in Pakistani waters off the coast of Sindh province.
Curfew has been declared on April 3 in Gilgit after sectarian clashes.
The Crime Investigation Department of the police raided a factory in Karachi on April 21 and recovered around 4,000 hand grenades.
A bomb on a train was defused by the Police Forces of Pakistan on April 25 in Attock, Punjab province.

Arrests: On April 29, police arrested two local militants in Swat district. They said that local militant commander Qari Israel was arrested in Ashari area on the outskirts of Matta tehsil during a raid.

Arrests: On May 5, police in Swat district have arrested seven militants including a key commander, Qari Atiq ur Rehman, while a former union council nazim who was also arrested on attempting to free the militant commander. The police conducted raids in Odigram area on receiving tip-off.
Two offices of Sunni Tehreek have been set on fire by unidentified men on May 5 in Karachi, Sindh.

ASSOC_ACTOR_2: ANP: Awami National Party; Pashtun Ethnic Group (Pakistan)
NOTES: The shrine of the deceased Pashto poet and leader of ANP was destroyed by unknown militants on May 9 in Akora of Nowshera in Khyber Pakhtunkhwa.

Arrests: On May 27, the local police managed to arrest a Taliban commander from Tehsil Matta of Khyber Pakhtunkhwa. The police conducted raid in Kala Kot area of Tehsil Matta and arrested a prominent commander of the terrorists, Barkat Ali.
The Police have arrested 7 suspects and seized 2 explosive laden vehicles in Kuchlak, Quetta of Balochistan on May 30.

Property destruction: On May 31, armed men torched the house of Sunni Tehreek's (ST) unit in-charge in the Shah Faisal Colony No-5 (Sindh). The house was set alight by activists of a certain political party, who managed to flee after setting fire.

Property destruction: A man was slightly injured in what police described as a cracker explosion outside a political party's office in Husainabad, late on Monday night. Two men on a motorcycle threw a cracker at a unit office of the Muttahida Qaumi Movement.

Agreement: On June 5, the Akkakhel peace committee has announced a general amnesty for all militants affiliated with any organisation if they surrender unconditionally. Committee's chief Haji Gul Meeran, the militants have been given the deadline of June 10 to surrender.

ASSOC_ACTOR_1: LeI: Lashkar-e-Islam; AI: Ansar-ul-Islam
NOTES: As reported on June 11, the Tehrik-i-Taliban, Lashkar-e-Islam and Ansar-ul-Islam took control of entire Tirah Valley in Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, except Bazaar Zakhakhel. The Taliban made announcements on loudspeakers and asked the residents to hoist white flags atop their houses and volunteer one person per family to join the TTP. The Kukikhel Lashkar didn't go into battle with the militants, because they were stronger than themselves.
As reported on June 11, the TTP destroyed houses of Kukikhel elders in Bagh and Sra Vela of Tirah Valley in Khyber Pakhtunkhwa.

ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Refugees/IDPs (Pakistan)
NOTES: As reported on June 11, when the TTP took control of Tirah Valley in Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, people left their houses and moved to Ali Masjid and Ghundi in Jamrud. As reported on June 23, the number of displaced families reached 1,800.
Police Forces of Pakistan found a bomb-laden vehicle in Quetta of Balochistan, arrested the driver and defused the bomb on June 26.

The Pakistani Government announced on July 3 it would reopen the NATO supply routes into Afghanistan. It was closed on November 26 in 2011, when American aircraft killed 24 Pakistani soldiers. The TTP threatened to attack the trucks and their drivers.

Arrests: On July 20, eleven wanted criminals, including Lyari gangsters and a Tehreek-e-Taliban (TTP) commander, were arrested by the Anti-Extremism Cell (AEC) in various raids in Karachi city (Sindh).
The NATO supply route through Torkham in Landi Kotal of Khyber Agency, FATA has been closed again on July 24, because of security reasons. The TTP has threatened to attack any NATO truck.
The NATO supply route through Torkham in Landi Kotal of Khyber Agency, FATA has been opened again on August 4.
During raids in Quetta of Balochistan, Police Forces seized 12,000 kilograms of explosive materials in 20 sacks, 20 rockets, 15 suicide vests and several other weapons on August 9.
Police Forces of Pakistan defused a bomb in the hydery market in Karachi of Sindh on August 14.
As reported on August 15, the police forces seized 683 sticks of dynamite and 780 safety fuses during raids in Shabqadar of Charsadda in Khyber Pakhtunkhwa.

ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Police Forces of Pakistan (2008-2013) Pakistan Rangers
NOTES: The Government of the Province Sindh extended the additional powers of Rangers on August 18 for another 3 months. Rangers personnel can conduct home searches and arrest suspects.

ACTOR1: Police Forces of Pakistan (2008-2013) Bomb Disposal Squad
NOTES: A bomb planted in front of the District Police Officer headquarters in Attock of Punjab has been defused on August 26.
The Police Forces arrested the leader of the banned group Lashkar-e-Jhangvi on August 30 in Lahore.
Curfew was declared in North Waziristan Agency of FATA on Sep 3, after 2 security forces have been injured by a bomb attack.
Property destruction: On September 7, unknown armed men set ablaze two NATO containers in the Dasht area of Mastung district (Balochistan).
Militants targeted a government primary school in Badaber of Peshawar in Khyber Pakhtunkhwa on Sep 12. No injuries have been reported, but two rooms of the school were completely destroyed.

All mobile phone services were blocked on Sep 21 in 15 cities including Karachi, Lahore, Murree, Multan, Peshawar, Khanewal and Chakwal to prevent violent incidents because of the Yaum-i-Ishq-i-Rasool.
Rallies and processions have been banned in Karachi of Sindh on Sep 27 for three days.

ACTOR1: Police Forces of Pakistan (2008-2013) Bomb Disposal Squad
NOTES: As reported on Oct 3, a 10 kilogram bomb was defused by the Police Forces in Peshawar of Khyber Pakhtunkhwa.
As reported on Oct 5, the Police Forces arrested 7 alleged militants and seized 125 kg of explosives, 7 suicide jackets, rocket launchers, weapons and bullets in Karachi.

ACTOR1: Police Forces of Pakistan (2008-2013) Bomb Disposal Squad
NOTES: A bomb was defused by the Police Forces on Oct 9 in front of the house of a PPP politician in Larkana of Sindh.

ACTOR1: Police Forces of Pakistan (2008-2013) Bomb Disposal Squad
NOTES: A bomb was defused by the Police Forces on Oct 9 in front of the house of a PPP politician in Nawabshah of Sindh.

ACTOR1: Police Forces of Pakistan (2008-2013) Bomb Disposal Squad
NOTES: A bomb was defused by the Police Forces on Oct 9 in front of the house of a PPP politician in Digri of Mirpurkhas of Sindh.
33 Indian fishermen have been arrested on Oct 10 for fishing illegally in Pakistan's territorial waters.

The Police Forces of Pakistan arrested 50 suspects in the Swat district of Khyber Pakhtunkhwa and other districts on 13.10.2012. Among them are 3 TTP members, who have been involved in the attack on activist Malala Yousufzai. The number of detained suspects rose to 120.
The chief of the TTP Orakzai chapter in Nowshera has been arrested on Oct 16. Taliban denies the claim.
Arrests: On October 23, security forces rounded up more than 100 suspects after the offensive in Bara Tehsil area (Khyber Agency, FATA).
Because of threats to national security cellphone services across the country have been suspended on eid on Oct 27.
Property destruction: On 2 November 2012, unidentified men torched an all male primary public school in Khwar Pattey village of Charbagh (Khyber Pakhtunkhwa).

ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Police Forces of Pakistan (2008-2013) Frontier Corps
NOTES: The Government of Balochistan extended for another month the police powers granted to the Frontier Corps to maintain law and order in the Quetta district on Nov 03.

As reported on Nov 14, to support the Afghan Government in their peace negotiations with the TTP, the Pakistani Government released seven or eight Taliban militants from prison. It is said that more militants are planned to be released.
To prevent terror attacks mobile phone services have been suspended for eight hours in Karachi of Sindh on Nov 16.

During raids in Gujrat of Punjab on Nov 16, 2 men were arrested and five jackets prepared for suicide bombings, material to make 60 more jackets, firearms and 75 kilograms of explosive material were recovered from the arrested men.

ACTOR1: Police Forces of Pakistan (2008-2013) Bomb Disposal Squad
NOTES: When a 13-year-old suicide bomber failed to detonate his vest, the bomb disposal squad of the Pakistani Police defused the explosives from his body on Nov 20 in Peshawar of Khyber Pakhtunkhwa. He was arrested later.

ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Uthmanzai Tribal Militia (Pakistan)
NOTES: The TTP and the Uthmanzai tribe formed a joint lashkar on Nov 22 in Miranshah of North Waziristan Agency in FATA to take action against those elements, who are involved in target killings, kidnappings and attacks on security forces.
Mobile phone services have been suspended on Nov 24 in 50 cities nationwide, after a series of suicide bombings were detonated using mobile phones.

ACTOR1: Police Forces of Pakistan (2008-2013) Bomb Disposal Squad
NOTES: A bomb was defused under the car of a popular journalist and TV personality by the Police Forces on Nov 26 in Islamabad. The bomb was planted by the TTP, because the journalist previously had criticized their attack on Malala Yousufzai.
Property destruction: On November 26, unknown men set a girls school on fire in Afghan Refugees Camp at late night in Chagai (Blaochistan). No loss of life or injuries reported.

ACTOR1: Police Forces of Pakistan (2008-2013) Pakistan Rangers
NOTES: The Pakistan Rangers arrested over 70 people in the Maghopir area of Gadap Town in Karachi of Sindh on Dec 1. 13 of them were suspected TTP members. Several weapons including a bomb-making factory have been seized.
As reported on Dec 2, two suicide bombers were killed before reaching their destination in Garang area of Pandiali Tehsil in Mohmand Agency, FATA.
As reported on Dec 2, a bomb exploded, when a handler tried to attach it on a motorcycle of an attempted suicide bomber in Peshawar in Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, killing both of them.
Unknown men attacked a graveyard belonging to the Ahmadi community on Dec 3 in the Model Town area of Gulberg in Lahore, Punjab. About 120 graves were destroyed.
Non-violent activity: On December 4, border guards at Torkham (Khyber Agency, FATA) fired warning shots after a NATO jet intruded into the airspace of Pakistan.

As reported on Dec 8, the Police Forces arrested 54 suspects in Karachi of Sindh a son of the deputy chief of the banned Tehrik-i-Taliban Pakistan's Karachi chapter. Weapons have been seized from the suspects.
Mobile phone services have been suspended in Karachi of Sindh on Dec 28 due to terrorism threat and security concerns.
In support of the Afghanistan peace negotiations between the Afghan Government and the TTP, Pakistan released 8 more Taliban prisoners on Dec 31.

Arrests: On January 8, police arrested 50 Afghan nationals at Baraki Camp in Swabi, 40 of whom were taken into custody. Police allege the Afghans were a part of militant cells, and had been planning on attacking charities and aid workers.

Property seizure: A group of armed men, posing themselves as henchmen of an influential feudal lord, forced their way into a model village meant for internally displaced people in Gujjo town of Thatta district and warned the inhabitants to vacate the area or face the consequences. The men occupied the homes of many residents, who are displaced by rains and flooding, and resorted to aerial firing and verbal intimidation.
Property destruction: On April 1, unidentified armed men attacked and destroyed a fleet of NATO trucks near Quetta. No casualties were reported.
Property destruction: On April 23, a NATO tanker was attacked with gunfire in Jamrud (FATA). The tanker was damaged but no casualties were reported.
Property destruction: On May 10, militants attacked the house of a BNP leader with a petrol bomb in Balochistan. No casualties were reported.
Arrests: On May 14, the head of TTP Karachi was arrested by the police.
Property destruction: LeI militants burned down the houses of several peace activists and pro-government tribal elders in Tirah Valley. No casualties were reported.

Agreement: On 2 June 2013, 700 Baloch militants have laid down the arms before the army at Dera Bugti (Balochistan) in response to government offer for general amnesty and rehabilitation. Militants who have surrendered are from Baloch Republican Army, a Baloch separatist outfit.

Property destruction: On July 6, suspected Baloch Separatists attacked three oil tankers in the Mastung (Balochistan). The militants open fired on the tankers destroying one and damaging the others. There was no reported loss of life in the incident.

Arrests: On July 7, following recent security threats, police forces arrested 200 foreigners in Lahore city (mostly Afghan nationals). The search and arrest operations follows the bomb blast in Anarkali area of Lahore.

Property destruction: On July 13, suspected Baloch Separatists attacked an oil tanker in the Mastung area (Balochistan). The militants open fired on the tanker causing damage but no loss of life or injuries.

Property destruction: On July 14, suspected Baloch Separatists attacked four oil tankers for a Chinese company in the Chagai area (Balochistan). The militants open fired on the tanker causing damage but no loss of life or injuries.
Pakistan's military forces regained control of a strategic location in Tirah valley without facing any resistance from militants in the area.

Property destruction: On July 21, suspected Baloch Separatists attacked two oil tankers in Mastung area (Balochistan). The militants open fired on the tanker causing moderate damage, but no loss of life or injuries.

Property destruction: A Quetta bound tanker was carrying fuel for Pakistan Air Force in Keri Door area when it came under attack in Dasht area of Mastung district. The driver escaped unhurt. No one was reported injured. No group has claimed responsibility for the attack.

Arrests: On August 3, the security forces and CID Police in a joint operation arrested an operations commander of Tehrik-e-Taliban Pakistan (TTP) Mufti Rehmat and nine other suspected militants in Nowshera (Khyber Pakhtunkhwa).

Arrests: On August 7, a commander of the militant group involved in D.I Khan jail attack has been arrested in wounded condition and during investigations has revealed significant disclosures regarding jail break in which 250 hard core prisoners had escaped. He is suspected to be from TTP.

Arrests: On August 17, more than 100 suspects were arrested during a search operation in Nowshera (Khyber Pakhtunkhwa). Security forces carried out search operation against criminals and anti-social elements at Jalozai Refugees camp. Intelligence agencies had revealed that three suspected suicide bombers were hiding in Jalozai Camp.
Arrests: On August 29, Karachi police in their continued drive against criminals arrested 129 accused including political activists from various parts of the city.

Non-violent activity: On September 2, members of the Tehreek-i-Taliban Pakistan (TTP) raided the house of sacked Punjabi Taliban chief Asmatullah Muavia in the suburbs of Miranshah, North Waziristan Agency. The TTP removed Muavia from his position as punishment for accepting the government's recent offer to hold peace talks.

Agreement: On September 5, as many as 48 people surrendered to the police in Multan city (Punjab) after week long negotiations between regional peace committees of the Ahlsunnat Wal Jamaat (AWSJ) and the local Shia community. 24 people each from both sides turned themselves in.

Property destruction: On September 12, NATO vehicle has been destroyed in an attack by suspected TTP militants in Sado Khel, Landi Kotal area of Khyber Agency. However no causality has been reported. The attackers burned the truck after throwing fuel on it.

Agreement: On September 21, Afghan Taliban leader Mullah Abdul Ghani Baradar's was released in Islamabad city on American pressure and on the demand of the government of Afghanistan. He was the highest-ranking Afghan Taliban prisoner in Pakistan.
Arrests: On October 27, law enforcers arrested around 103 suspects including Lyari gangsters, targeted killers and political workers across Karachi city (Sindh).

ACTOR2: AQIS: Al Qaeda in the Indian Subcontinent
NOTES: Arrests: On December 14, security forces arrested an Al-Qaeda affiliated and a most wanted militant Muhammad Adnan alias Abu Hamza in a raid at Keamari area of Karachi city (Sindh).
Looting: On January 21, armed men hijacked an official vehicle, snatched mobile phones and polio vaccines from a polio team in Balochistan's Panjgur district.
Agreement: On March 2, Pakistan's government has decided to halt airstrikes against Taliban militants in response to a month-long ceasefire.
Agreement: Pakistan's government decided to resume peace talks with the TTP on Tuesday. The talks comes after a recent attack on Frontier Corps personnel.

Property destruction: On May 10, gunmen intercepted three container trucks carrying Nato supplies en route to Afghanistan in Khyber tribal region and torched one of them in Jamrud. No injuries were reported.
Arrests: On May 10, 52 suspected militants had been taken into custody after an IED blast in Ghulam Khan area (North Waziristan Agency, FATA).

On May 28, a 'powerful Taliban faction' led by Khalid Mehsud has split off from the group in South Waziristan due to the TTP having 'slipped into the hands of a bunch of conspirators who receive money from foreign elements for carrying out bomb attacks at public places'.

Security measures: On 16 June 2014, Pakistani ground troops have surrounded the North Waziristan Agency isolating it from neighboring agencies and FATA to block any movement of militants. Additionally, 40,000 troops have moved and cordoned off all militant bases, including Mirali and Miranshah. Afghan security forces including the Afghan National Army and the Afghan Border Police have also been requested to seal the border on their side to facilitate elimination of militants who attempt to escape across the border.
Non-violent activity: The proscribed militant group Lashkar-i-Islam forcibly stopped anti-polio vaccination in Baaz Garrha area of Bara tehsil in Khyber Agency on 17 June 2014.
Arrests: On June 22, at least 88 suspects including some foreigners were arrested by police during a search operation in Hayatabad in Peshwara city (Khyber Pakhtunkhwa).
Arrests: On June 22, about 170 suspects were arrested in a midnight search operation conducted jointly by Swabi and Mardan police in a village near Buner district in Swabi (Khyber Pakhtunkhwa).
Arrests: On June 25, police arrested hundreds of people after fighters opened fire on a passenger plane during landing in Peshawar city (Khyber Pakhtunkhwa).

ACTOR1: Police Forces of Pakistan (2013-2018) Pakistan Rangers
ACTOR2: Police Forces of India (2014-) Border Security Force
NOTES: Arrests: On August 6, an Indian Border Security Guard was arrested for crossing the working border near Kuleil village in Sialkot's Bajwat sector. The Indian soldier was taken into custody for interrogation.

Security measures: On August 19, addressing a press conference in Islamabad, Federal Interior Minister Chaudhry Nisar Ali Khan said that the government has decided to hand over security of the Red Zone to the Pakistani army. This comes after recent demonstrations by PTI and PAT in the capital.
Arrests: FC personnel raided a militant hideout in Faisal Colony. Three militants were arrested and a large quantity of arms and ammunition was seized. No injuries were reported.
On September 1, members of a group called Al-Jihad carried out an arson attack at Gorbam Private School in Turbat (Kech, Bangladesh). The school was targeted for providing Western education.

Property destruction: An ice factory belonging to the Vice-President of the Balochistan National Party (Syed Ehsan Shah) was damaged when suspected rioters threw a hand-grenade at the building. No casualty or injuries were reported.

ACTOR1: Police Forces of Pakistan (2013-2018) Pakistan Rangers
NOTES: Arrests: On September 24, Pakistan's Rangers raided MQM's offices in Karachi city arresting 30 party workers in the process. Eight of those arrested were later released. It was reported that the Ranger's allegedly took 200 MQM workers during the raid. However, the number of official arrests remained lower (at 30).

Agreement: On September 29, a total of 85 suspected Baloch Separatists have surrendered at a ceremony in Quetta city (Balochistan). The militants vowed to renounce violence and welcomed the general amnesty announced by the provincial government.

Property destruction: On October 17, unidentified militants ambushed PPP's office in Karachi city. The attackers open fired on the building before setting it alight. No PPP workers or civilians were present at the property.

Property destruction: On October 19, LeI militants torched the properties of fellow militants who had surrendered to Pakistan's military in Bara (Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, FATA). The incident caused severe damage, but no loss of life or injuries were reported.

Agreement: On October 22, LeI leadership and militants surrendered to security forces in Khyber Agency (FATA). The event comes as Pakistan's government call for militants in FATA to hand in their weapons.

ASSOC_ACTOR_2: Sunni Tehreek; MQM: Muttahida Qaumi Movement
NOTES: Arrests: On October 28, following a gun-attack on police personnel, police forces conducted a raid in Karachi city, resulting in 24 Sunni Tehreek and 16 MQM workers being arrested.

ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Zakakhel Communal Group (Pakistan)
NOTES: Agreement: On November 5, 30 LI militants surrendered to the military in Bara city (FATA), belonging to the Zakhakhel Tribe.
Property destruction: On November 20, a Hindu temple in Tando Mohamad Khan (Sindh) was burned down by unknown assailants.
Property destruction: On November 21, members of Amn Lashkar Khajuri set fire to two houses belonging to LI commanders in Khyber Pakhtunkhwa.
Property destruction: On December 30, unknown militants set a girls school on fire in Mandaan (Bajaur Agency, FATA).
Property destruction: On December 30, unknown militants set a girls school on fire in Kandai Baba (Khyber Agency, FATA).
Property destruction: On 1 Jan, the houses of 3 militants were destroyed by the military during a search operation in Bajaur Agency (FATA).
Arrests: On January 9, police arrested a leader of the banned Tehreek-e-Taliban and recovered propaganda literature from his possession in Lahore city (Punjab).
arrests: Law enforcement agencies arrested multiple suspected militants including a Tehreek-e-Taliban Pakistan (TTP) commander in Harnai.
arrests: Security forces arrested three militants including key TehreekeTaliban commander during search operation in Pishin distirict.

arrests: Ahl-e-Sunnat Wal Jamaat (ASWJ) party Chief Mohammad Ahmed Ludhianvi and other party members were arrested for spreading religious hate, violating the Amplifier Act and interfering in governmental function in a First Information Report filed at Secretariat police station.
Arrests: The police arrested a militant commander, Ajar Gul, in Peshawar.
Arrests: On 26 Feb, four diplomats, among scores of Afghan nationals, were detained by policemen from scattered localities of University Town Peshawar.
Arrests: Security forces the leader of Jundullah, from Lak Pass near Quetta.

Arrests: On March 3, security forces arrested four members of the banned outfit Tehreek-e-Taliban Pakistan (TTP), including a commander during a raid in the Chapri Naryab of Hangu city (Khyber Pakhtunkhwa).
Arrests: A TTP commander was arrested during a raid carried out by security forces in Naurang village, district Bannu.

On 8 March, security forces razed to the ground the house of a militant commander, Saddam Khan who had allegedly acted as a facilitator in the Army Public School attack. In Jamrud area (Khyber Agency, FATA).
Arrests: The commander of a banned militant outfit and seven other militants were arrested by the Anti-Extremist Cell (AEC) of the Counter Terrorism Department (CTD) in Baldia Town.
Arrests: A militant commander was arrested from Sonai Darra in Upper Dir.
Arrests: The district police officer has confirmed the arrest of Anjuman-e-Mazareen Pakistan (AMP) Kulyana Estate president nominated in 71 cases including Anti-Terrorism Act (ATA) and murder.

Property destruction: On 15 March, suspected militants torched the houses of three pro-government peace volunteers in Tirah valley (Buner, KP). It is unclear if the owners of the house were at home at the time of the attack.
Arrests: Under the National Action Plan, police arrested TTP deputy chief along with three other terrorists.
Arrests: On 6 April, police in Lahore arrested 69 suspects for their alleged involvement in vandalism and an incident of mob violence that resulted in the lynching of two men in Youhanabad in March.

ASSOC_ACTOR_1: HUM: Harakat ul-Mujahideen
NOTES: Arrests: The Crime Investigation Agency (CIA) arrested a member of the banned Tehreek-e-Taliban Pakistan (TTP) and commander of Harkatul Mujahideen, who had allegedly kidnapped Colonel Imam, a retired officer of the Inter-Services Intelligence (ISI) and squadron leader (retd) Khalid Khawaja.
Detonation: The Islamic State's commander-designate for Pakistan was killed with two others in a bomb explosion, soon after they planted the bomb in the Toor Dara area of Tirah Valley.
Arrests: A commander of LeJ was arrested in a joint operation by Police and security forces.
Security forces claim to have taken control of the Nakai and Ziarat Sar areas of Malikdinkhel in Bara tehsil of Khyber Agency.

ACTOR1: Police Forces of Pakistan (2013-2018) Counter Terrorism Department
NOTES: On May 5, CTD police carried a successful raid in Lasbella university hostel in Uthal city (Balochistan) and captured key Lashker-e-Jhangvi suspect. No reports of clashes.

ACTOR1: Police Forces of Pakistan (2013-2018) Pakistan Rangers
NOTES: Arrests: Between May 14-15, as many as 200 suspects were arrested from different areas of Karachi city by Pak Rangers personnel in relation to an attack on Ismaili community members in the city.
Arrests: JUI-F district General Secretary Mufti Gohar Shah along with his associates were arrested in connection to a firing incident on election day.

ACTOR2: Police Forces of Pakistan (2013-2018) Frontier Corps
NOTES: Arrests: As reported on June 3, FC arrested two most wanted key BLF militant in Pasni (Balochistan).

Agreement: On June 4, Haji Wali Kalati, the central commander of the United Baloch Army (A splinter group from the BLA) surrendered to the Pakistani authorities in Quetta city (Balochistan) during a press conference with people from the PML-N by his side.

arrests: As many as 88 political activists, including a newly-elected member of the district council and some from PPP, were arrested after firing by supporters of the winning and losing district council candidates from union council Jahangirabad.
Arrests: The central president of the banned Ahle Sunnat Wal Jamaat (ASWJ) Aurangzeb Farooqi was arrested near Taxila.
Detonation: On June 6, two alleged suicide bombers were killed when their jackets exploded in Sargodha, Punjab. Apart from the suicide bombers, no one was injured.
Arrests: Police in Khairpur arrested the District Information Secretary of the JSQM Khairpur Deedar Almani, no info was given on charges or actual location of his detention.
Agreement: On 13 June, two commanders, along with 47 militants from insurgent groups in Balochistan, laid down their arms.
Agreement: On June 15, over 100 Baloch militants surrendered and pledged their allegiance to the country in Quetta (Balochistan).

ACTOR1: Police Forces of Pakistan (2013-2018) Frontier Corps
NOTES: Around 18 June, Frontier Corps Balochistan arrested a key militant commander along with weapons in Tump area (Kech, Balochistan).
Arrests: The Bhan Syedabad Police arrested PPP leader Ali Sher Bhand along with his two relatives.
Arrests: On July 10, a local commander of TTP was arrested in Karachi city (Sindh) along with six of his accomplices during a raid by the Counter-Terrorism Department (CTD) police.

Arrests: Rangers raided the Nine Zero headquarters of MQM and took into custody two senior leaders of the party, including the in-charge of its coordination committee, for 'facilitating hate speeches against peace in Karachi'.
Arrests: On August 28, police raided several seminaries and houses in Muzaffargarh area (Punjab) and took into custody 40 to 50 suspects belonging to the ASWJ and LeJ.

Agreement: On August 14, 400 Baloch separatists laid down their arms in a ceremony held on the occasion of Pakistan's Independence Day, in Quetta city (Balochistan). The ex-militants came from several different separatist groups.
Arrests: On August 19th, more than 50 activists of the IJeT: Islami Jamaat-e-Talaba Pakistan were arrested in Iqbal Town, Lahore, for allegedly torturing a student of Wahdat Road Science College.
Arrests: On August 20th, police forces destroyed several offices of the Tehreek-e-Taliban Pakistan in different areas West Karachi, and arrested at least two dozen suspected TTP militants.

Detonation: On August 27th, three militants were killed in an explosion while planting an IED on the rail track near Sibi. They were allegedly planning to explode the track when a train passed overtop.

NOTES: On September 5th, Bomb Disposal Squad personnel defused a suicide jacket found planted in the Sarai Kharbuza area of Islamabad.

NOTES: Defusal: On September 5th, Bomb Disposal Squad personnel defused an IED in the Sariab Road area of Quetta after security forces arrested a militant while they were planting it under a bridge.

ACTOR1: Police Forces of Pakistan (2013-2018) Counter Terrorism Department
NOTES: On 27 November, CTD police claim to have arrested the Karachi head of Hizbut Tahrir in Karachi city (Sindh).

Arrests: On December 4, as many as 35 suspected militants were arrested by security forces in the Khuga Khel area of Landi Kotal tehsil (Khyber Agency, FATA).
On 11 Dec, a militant was killed when his hand-grenade exploded when he was escaping from the security forces during a search operation in Narsas area near Gomal (Zhob, Balochistan).

Arrests: On December 12, over 500 suspected persons, including Afghan refugees, were arrested in search operations in Swabi, Charsadda and other parts of Khyber Pakhtunkhwa ahead of the first anniversary of Peshawar's Army Public School (APS) tragedy on Dec 16.

Non-violent activity: Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi made a surprise visit to Pakistan to meet Prime Minister Nawaz Sharif in Lahore. The prime minister was in the country only for a few hours, but this was the first visit by an Indian premier to Pakistan in over 10 years.

ASSOC_ACTOR_2: PML-N: Pakistan Muslim League-Nawaz; Former Government of Pakistan (2013-2018)
NOTES: Property destruction: On December 27, unidentified armed men set on fire the house of former provincial minister for fisheries Akbar Askani in Mand Jat area of the Kech district. Mr. Askani is contesting for Balochistan Assembly seat PB-50 (Turbat-3) in the by-election as the PML-N candidate.

ACTOR1: Police Forces of Pakistan (2013-2018) Counter Terrorism Department
NOTES: Arrests: On December 28, Pakistani counter terrorism forces busted a cell of the militant Islamic State group operating in Sialkot, arrested eight suspects and seized weapons, explosives and laptops, as well as a large number of compact discs containing publicity material.

Property destruction: On 30 Dec, the house of a Balochistan National Party-Awami candidate (residing in Kech) was torched by unidentified militants. No loss of life was reported however the house was completely demolished by the fire. This is the second attack on a candidate running from this area in the last few days.

ACTOR1: Police Forces of Pakistan (2013-2018) Pakistan Rangers
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Police Forces of Pakistan (2013-2018)
NOTES: Arrests: On December 30, the Rangers and police have arrested 77 suspects, including militants, during a joint search operation in different areas of Karachi city (Sindh).
Weapons seizure: On 1 Jan, 2-kg of explosive material with detonators and a hand-grenade were recovered from two militants at Chak 301-GB (Punjab).
On 2 Jan, police foiled a attack by defusing live rockets with fuses attached in hidden sacks near Wanda Arsla police check post (Lakki Marwat, KP).

ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Military Forces of Pakistan (2013-2018)
NOTES: Weapons seizure: On 2 Jan, the police and security forces seized a large cache of explosives in a rural area of Lakki Marwat (KP).
On 3 Jan, police defused an Improvised Explosive Device (IED) near the fish market at Joint Road in Quetta (Balochistan).
On 3 Jan, security forces defused a mine near the Sajjad security checkpost in the Loey Shalman area near Landi Kotal (Khyber Agency, FATA).

On 4 Jan, bomb disposal experts defused an explosive device recovered from a road during a VIP movement in Lahore city (Punjab). A news channel said that the convoy of Interior Minister Chaudhry Niar Ali Khan was scheduled to pass through the route from where the five-kilogram bomb was discovered.
On 4 Jan, a 10-kg bomb was defused by a bomb disposal squad of the police in the Hanjarwal Bridge area of Nawab Town (Lahore, Punjab).

ACTOR1: Police Forces of Pakistan (2013-2018) Bomb Disposal Squad
NOTES: Defusal: On either September 1st or 2nd, members of the Bomb Disposal Squad defused a 5kg IED and two grenades found in Karkhano Market, Peshawar.
As reported on 10 Jan, Frontier Corps (FC) personnel defused a bomb planted on a roadside in Turbat (Kech, Balochistan). that was believed to be meant to hit an FC patrol.
Agreement: On 15 Jan, 79 TTP militants surrendered to the political administration of North Waziristan Agency in Miranshah (FATA).

Agreement: On January 15, as many as 79 militants have given up their armed struggle against the state after a successful operation carried out by security forces in North Waziristan Agency (FATA), the Inter-Services Public Relations (ISPR) said in a statement . Three militant commanders were among those who laid down their arms. They handed over their weapons to the political administration and security forces in Miranshah area of the agency.

Arrests: At least 60 suspected IS militants were arrested in raids across KPK and FATA, including in Peshawar, Karak, Lakki Marwat, DIK, Kohat, and Orakzai, Khyber, and Kurram Agencies. Grouped at Peshawar at GP3.
On 17 Jan, Frontier Corps foiled a major attack in Balochistan's Dera Bugti district, defusing an improvised explosive device (IED) weighing around 17 kilogrammes.

ACTOR1: Police Forces of Pakistan (2013-2018) Counter Terrorism Department
ACTOR2: AQIS: Al Qaeda in the Indian Subcontinent
NOTES: On 21 Jan, Counter-Terrorism Department officers arrested 11 militants including two Al-Qaeda commanders and a Lashker-e-Jhangvi (LeJ) commander and recovered a large quantity of arms, ammunition, and bombs in Orangi Town (Karachi, Sindh).
On 21 Jan, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa police recovered a bomb near Gulbahar bus terminal in Peshawar (KP). They caught the bomb planter as he was setting it, and then the bomb defusal squad defused it.
On 21 Jan, the Bomb Disposal Squad (BDS) foiled a major attack when they defused two separate bombs in Peshawar (KP).

ACTOR1: Police Forces of Pakistan (2013-2018) Counter Terrorism Department
NOTES: As reported on 13 Jan, the CTD carried out a raid at a house situated in Bar Abbass Khel village in Hangu district and apprehended at least five militants including militant commander. The CTD also recovered a rocket launcher, explosive materials, four hand-grenades and sophisticated weapons.
On 26 Jan, police recovered an explosive device weighing around five kilograms, which the bomb disposal unit later defused. The bomb was found in the Bashirabad area of Peshawar (KP).
On 28 Jan, a major attack was foiled as the Bomb Disposal Squad (BDS) defused five home-made bombs planted near an electricity pylon in Phandu near Jamil Chowk (Peshwar district, KP).

ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Police Forces of Pakistan (2013-2018)
NOTES: Arrests: The personnel of Pakistan Army and district police conducted an intelligence-based operation in the mountainous region of Malikabad on Wednesday. The DPO said that about 130 suspects had been arrested and those found innocent would be released after the initial interrogation.

ACTOR1: Police Forces of Pakistan (2013-2018) Frontier Corps
NOTES: Arrests: 35 TTP militants were arrested in raids in the Sariab area of Quetta after a suicide attack hit an FC convoy.

Arrests: Law enforcement agencies and police in the Kohat area on Friday arrested nearly three dozen suspects on Friday including a Taliban commander and facilitators.

On 13 Feb, law enforcement agencies foiled a bid to blow up a private school in Qandeel Colony (Bagh district, Azad Kashmir) by defusing two home-made bombs which were planted in classrooms. TTP are suspected in planting the bombs.

ACTOR1: Police Forces of Pakistan (2013-2018) Counter Terrorism Department
NOTES: On 16 Feb, Counter-Terrorism Department (CTD) carried out targeted operation in different areas of the metropolis, arresting four TTP militants and recovering a huge cache of arms and ammunition.
On 26 Feb, the Bomb Disposal Squad (BDS) foiled a major attack by defusing a six kilograms bomb in Peshawar (KP).

NOTES: Arrests: On March 21, Rangers personnel arrested Muttahida Qaumi Movement (MQM) Coordination Committee Deputy Convener Shahid Pasha in a raid in the Gulshan-e-Jauhar area of Karachi city (Sindh).

ACTOR1: Police Forces of Pakistan (2013-2018) Pakistan Rangers
NOTES: Arrests: On March 25, Pakistan claims to have captured an Indian RAW spy from Balochistan amongst Baloch separatists from the southern part of the province. Details around the event remain murky, and India claims the man is a retired Indian naval officer, and denies having any ties.
Arrests: On April 2, Intelligence agents arrested a commander of the BLA in Rahim Yar Khan (Punjab).

ACTOR1: Police Forces of Pakistan (2013-2018) Pakistan Rangers

NOTES: On 16 April, Counter Terrorism Department of police claimed to have arrested two Pakistani fishermen working for the Indian-spy agency RAW.

On 17 April, security forces defused three bombs and as many projectiles in Parachinar (Kurram Agency, FATA).

Agreement: On 18 April, at least 144 insurgents affiliated with the BLF, including four high-ranking commanders and 12 of their deputies, laid down their arms and announced their reintegration into mainstream society in Khuzdar, Balochistan.
On 26 April, the Bomb Disposal Unit foiled a attack and defused an explosive device weighing around 10 kilogrammes in the limits of Sarband police station (Peshawar, KP).
Security measures: On May 3, a curfew was imposed in Mohmand Agency (FATA) due to the worsening security situation.
Defusal: Security forces defused an improvised explosive device (IED) weighing 10kg.
Detonation: 3 suicide attackers were killed when one of their bombs blew up early.

Arrests: Police arrested an alleged militant commander, a resident of Swat, and recovered a heavy cache of arms, suicide vests and ammunition.
Defusal: Bomb Disposal Unit defused a bomb planted in front of a house.

Defusal: Security personnel defused three improvised explosive devices in Pandilai and Baizai subdivisions of Mohmand.
Arrests: Counter Terrorism Department Hazara Division arrested a TTP commander involved in number of terror activities in Hazara Division.
On 10 Aug, Counter Terrorism Department (CTD) arrested 2 agents of Afghanistan intelligence agency in Peshawar city (KP).

Security measures: On February 16, Pakistan closed the Torkham border crossing following the Sehwan shrine bombing. Shortly after Pakistan also shut the Chaman border crossing in Balochistan. The border crossing was reopened again on 21 March.
Arrests: As reported on February 18, Punjab police and other LEA personnel arrested at least 92 people in Punjab in an ongoing crackdown following the Sehwan shrine bombing.

NOTES: Arrests: On March 1, over 250 suspected persons including a significant number of Afghans were arrested in different areas of Karachi city (Sindh) by Police, Pak Rangers and FIA personnel after a tip off. This is in the context of the ongoing Operation Radd-ul-Fasaad and its expansion across the country.
The building of the Pasni Municipal Committee was damaged in a grenade attack by some people on a motorcycle.
March 10, unidentified individuals vandalized the Oxford Public School, located in Ghizer Valley (Ghizer, GB). They said they would bomb the school if the female teachers did not cover themselves.
Arrests: On March 13, police detained 38 suspects in raids in the Lodhran area (Punjab) as part of the anti-terror Operation Radd-ul-Fasaad.

Arrests: On March 14, at least 75 suspects were detained in raids conducted in Vehari while 46 suspected people were held by police and other law enforcement personnel in Bhakkar (Punjab). The raids were conducted as part of the ongoing anti-terror Operation Radd-ul-Fasaad.

Arrests: On March 14, at least 75 suspects were detained in raids conducted in Vehari (Punjab) while 46 suspected people were held by police and other law enforcement personnel in Bhakkar. The raids were conducted as part of the ongoing anti-terror Operation Radd-ul-Fasaad.

Arrests: On March 16, at least 63 suspects including 11 Afghans were apprehended under Operation Radd-ul-Fassad in Islamabad, Rawalpindi and Lahore. The raids netted suicide vests, weapons and explosives.

Arrests: On March 16, at least 63 suspects including 11 Afghans were apprehended under Operation Radd-ul-Fassad in Islamabad, Rawalpindi and Lahore. The raids netted suicide vests, weapons and explosives.

ACTOR1: Police Forces of Pakistan (2013-2018) Pakistan Rangers
NOTES: Agreement: On March 21, 20 alleged Baloch separatist militants including a commander surrendered to Pakistan Rangers in Balochistan. They claimed they had been paid by RAW agents through contacts in the Balochistan Republican Party.
On 9 April, Pakistan Maritime Security Agency (PMSA) apprehended eighteen Indian fishermen and seized three boats off the Gujarat coast.
Agreement: On April 21, 434 militants surrendered to the authorities, as part of a political reconciliation in Balochistan.
On 27 April, 29 Indian fishermen were arrested near Pakistan's coast for violating the maritime boundaries. 5 boats were also seized.
Arrests: As reported on May 18, some 200 clerks were taken into custody by the police from various localities of Islamabad city because they planned to hold a protest.

Agreement: On May 19, as part of the ongoing reconciliation process, 26 militants belonging to various outlawed militant groups surrendered their weapons to authorities in Balochistan's Khuzdar district.

Interception: The Foreign Office (FO) confirmed the downing of an Iranian unmanned aerial vehicle (UAV) in Balochistan's Panjgur area along the border. The wreckage was found on June 19th, but it is not clear when the drone was shot down.
Arrests: On August 21st, police arrested 25 suspected militants in 11 villages of Razar tehsil (Swabi district, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa).

ACTOR2: Police Forces of Pakistan (2013-2018) Frontier Corps
NOTES: Arrests: On September 25th, around 24 militants belonging to LeJ: Lashkar-e-Jhangvi, and other groups, were apprehended during raids by Frontier Corps in Balochistan as part of Operation Radd-ul-Fasaad.

ASSOC_ACTOR_2: JUD: Jamaat-ud-Dawa; TLP: Tehreek-e-Labbaik Pakistan; MML: Milli Muslim League; TLYRA: Tehreek-e-Labbaik Ya Rasool Allah
NOTES: Arrests: On October 12, police arrested up to 100 followers of different religious groups as they gathered at Lahore press club in Lahore city (Punjab), to hold a public debate. Among the groups were the International Labbaik Ya Rasool Allah (ILYRA), Tehreek Labbaik Ya Rasool Allah (TLYRA) Markazi Jamiat Ahle-hadith (MJAH), Jamaatud Dawa (JuD) and Milli Muslim League (MML).

Around October 19, the militant group Jamaat-ul-Ahrar named a new leader to head their group, Dost Muhammad, alias Asad Afridi, after their founder Omar Khalid Khurasani, was either seriously wounded and possibly killed in a USA drone attack in Afghanistan's Paktia province.

ASSOC_ACTOR_2: MQM-P: Muttahida Qaumi Movement-Pakistan; MQM-L: Muttahida Qaumi Movement-London; PPP: Pakistan Peoples Party; PSP: Pak Sarzameen Party
NOTES: Arrests: October 20th, police in Karachi detained around 50 suspects in a bid to end the surge of knife attacks in the city. Among those arrest were members of Muttahida Qaumi Movement (MQM) -Pakistan, MQM-London, Pakistan Peoples Party (PPP) and Pak Sarzameen Party (PSP).

NOTES: Defusal: Members of the Bomb Disposal Squad defused a bomb planted on the Shah Alam bridge in Peshawar, and members of the CTD arrested the militants who planted it.

NOTES: Defusal: On November 12th, members of the Bomb Disposal Squad defused a bomb found planted in the Landi Kotal Bazaar.

On January 3, a bomb went off prematurely while two suspected militants were attempting to plant it under a bridge in Loni area of Kulachi tehsil (Dera Ismail Khan, KP) killing both suspected militants.

NOTES: Arrests: On January 6, 2018, the Frontier Corps Balochistan arrested scores of Afghani immigrants and other suspects and also recovered IEDs, explosives, arms and ammunitions from Sui, Mastung, Barkhan, Loralai and Muslim Bagh areas of Balochistan province.

ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Baloch Separatists (Pakistan)
NOTES: Agreement: On January 25th, over 200 Baloch separatists, most from Baloch Liberation Front, surrendered their weapons in the presence of Chief Minister Balochistan Abdul Quddus Bizenjo, Commander Southern Command Asim Saleem Bajwa and other top civil and military officials in a ceremony held in Turbat.
Agreement: On January 26th, at least 32 unidentified militants from across Kashmore district surrendered their arms to police in Kandhkot.

ACTOR1: Police Forces of Pakistan (2013-2018) Bomb Disposal Squad
NOTES: Defusal: On January 30, members of the Bomb Disposal Squad defused two hand grenades found during a search operation in Mardan.

ACTOR1: Police Forces of Pakistan (2013-2018) Bomb Disposal Squad
NOTES: On 5 February, members of the police's Bomb Disposal Squad defused an IED found in the Qasimabad area of Hyderabad city (Sind).

ACTOR1: Police Forces of Pakistan (2013-2018) Bomb Disposal Squad
NOTES: On 6 February, members of the police's Bomb Disposal Squad defused 2 remote controlled IEDs found in the Qasimabad area of Hyderabad city (Sind).

Weapons seizure: On March 2, Pakistani security forces recovered a large cache of weapons and explosives during a raid in the Karbala area of Balochistan's Pishin district as part of Operation Radd-ul-Fasaad. The cache included sub-machine guns and 500kg of explosive material. 6 suspected militants were also arrested.

ACTOR1: Police Forces of Pakistan (2013-2018) Frontier Corps
NOTES: Weapons seizure: On March 4th, Frontier Corps personnel seized a very large cache of weapons, explosives, and ammunition from a militant hideout in Dera Bugti during a raid as part of Operation Radd-ul-Fasaad.
As reported on March 6th, an Indian surveillance drone was allegedly shot down by Pakistan Army personnel in the Chinikot area of Abbaspur tehsil, AJK.
Arrests: On March 24th, 32 suspected militants were arrested, along with weapons and narcotic staches, during police raids in Shakardara, Kohat district.
Movement of forces: As reported on 24 March, the Pakistani military deployed additional troops along the LoC and IB in AJK in response to a rise in tensions between Pak and India.

Arrests: On April 21st, police arrested arrested Pashtun Tahafuz Movement leader Ali Wazir, Awami Workers Party president Fanoos Gujjar, as well as other leaders and workers in Lahore, ahead of the large upcoming PTM protest at Mochi Gate, Lahore, which was scheduled to occur as part of the ongoing Pashtun movement despite a ban on the event by the Punjab government.

ACTOR1: Police Forces of Pakistan (2013-2018) Bomb Disposal Squad
NOTES: On 22 May, members of the police Bomb Disposal Squad defused an IED planted on the railroad track in Hyderabad city (Sind), which was allegedly intended to be blown up in front of a train.

Non-violent activity: On May 27, the Khyber Pakhtunkhwa assembly passed the FATA merger bill with a two-thirds majority. This was the last step in the approval process as earlier the bill had been passed by both the upper and lower houses of the Pakistan parliament.
Arrests: Punjab Police arrested a senior journalist, Naeem Gilani, in a supposedly fake case during the week of June 18. The incident garnered much attention and caused protests.
Arrests: FIA agents arrested a senior TTP commander, Bahadur Jan, from the international airport in Peshawar on June 18. He was attempting to leave the country.

Weapons seizure: Security forces (assumed police) discovered and seized a large number of weapons and ammunition during an intelligence-based operation in the Patwelai village of Ladha District, S Waziristan and the Gharlamai area of N Waziristan on June 27. Anti-tank mines, IEDs, 81 Mor bombs, RPG rockets, grenades, and ammo were all seized.

Weapons seizure: Security forces (assumed police) discovered and seized a large number of weapons and ammunition during an intelligence-based operation in the Patwelai village of Ladha District, S Waziristan and the Gharlamai area of N Waziristan on June 27. Anti-tank mines, IEDs, 81 Mor bombs, RPG rockets, grenades, and ammo were all seized.

Arrests: The NAB arrested Capt (r) Muhammad Safdar (former PM Nawaz Sharif's son-in-law) from Sixth Road in Rawalpindi on July 8 in connection to the Avenfield corruption case that implicated the top leaders of PML-N.

Arrests: Police reportedly arrested 141-400 PML-N workers in parts of Lahore and Rawalpindi on Wednesday night prior to the return of party leader Sharif later that week. At least 100 of the workers were arrested in connection to a FIR for an illegal car rally on July 8.
Arrests: Police arrested the mayor of Gujrat on July 12. As of July 14, he was still in detention but no case had been registered against him.
Arrests: Nawaz and Maryam Sharif, PML-N leaders, were arrested by Pakistani police upon their arrival at the international airport in Lahore on the evening of July 13.

ACTOR1: Police Forces of Pakistan (2013-2018) Frontier Corps
NOTES: Weapons seizure: On July 16, Frontier Corps (FC) Balochistan seized a large number of ammunition including 8 kg improvised explosive devices (IEDs) and 15 detonators under Radd-ul-Fasaad Operation in Quetta, Balochistan.

ACTOR1: Police Forces of Pakistan (2013-2018) Counter Terrorism Department
SOURCE: Nation (Pakistan); News International (Pakistan); Daily Regional Times (Pakistan)
NOTES: On July 17, the Counter-Terrorism Department of Sindh police claimed to have foiled a major militant activity by arresting at least four militants during separate raids in parts of Karachi city. The CTD officials claimed that a newly emerged militant group Ansarul Shariah Pakistan's local commander was among the arrested suspects. One militant died from his wounds after jumping from a building to avoid arrest. Other sources report these as TTP militants.

ACTOR1: Police Forces of Pakistan (2013-2018) Counter Terrorism Department
NOTES: On July 20, Police (CTD) force arrested at least 35 accused persons including four militants affiliated with Al-Qaeda while recovered weapons from their possession in Pak colony, Karachi.

Arrests: On July 20, police arrested the provincial president of the MQM from his house in Gujjar town, Sialkot, due to his alleged involvement in 'criminal activities'. Three others were also arrested, including the MQM leader's guard. Arms were also seized.

Detonation: On July 21, a watchman at a seminary was injured when a grenade went off in his hands. The watchman said he found the grenade outside the seminary, but the police believe he may have brought the grenade. 10 people were detained in connection with the incident, including the watchman.

Arrests: CTD Bahawalpur claimed to have foiled a major attack planned against political figures in the area by arresting three suspected militants of the TTP in an intelligence-based operation. They seized grenades, various bomb-making material including explosives, and blueprints of sensitive installations.
Unidentified assailants burnt down and damaged 12 schools, including at least half for girls, near Chilas town, GB Province before dawn on Aug 3. (The schools were closed at the time of the attack.)

Unidentified assailants burnt down a 13th or 14th school, this one for girls, in Darel tehsil, Diamer District, GB Province on Aug 4, following the destruction of 12 schools over the night of the 2nd which was followed by protests.
On August 7, unknown persons set ablaze two girls' schools during the night in the Khanozai area (Karezat, Pishin, Balochistan).

Property destruction: On 7 Aug, members of the Kothiwala Communal Group burned down the houses in or near Phullarwan (Lahore, Punjab) of those suspected to have killed their relatives earlier in the day over a land dispute.

Non-violent activity: Armed men raided homes and threatened residents in Qasim Panhwar village, near Tando Jam (Hyderabad Sindh) at midnight on Aug 17, targeting the citizens because they did not vote for PPP in the general elections.
Arrests: On Aug 20, security forces (assumed police) arrested more than 30 tribesmen from the Spera area (Jamrud tehsil, Kyber agency, KP) after an IED explosion in the area earlier that day.

ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Muslim Group (Pakistan)
NOTES: On 28 Aug, members of the Ahmadi and Muslim communities of Ghaseetpura (Faisalabad, Punjab) signed a written agreement to avoid bringing religion into personal and individual disputes and work through a local committee when issues arise.

ACTOR1: Police Forces of Pakistan (2018-) Frontier Corps
NOTES: Defusal: On Sep 10, Frontier Corps foiled a major militant plot by discovering and defusing 21 unclaimed IEDs weighing 235 kg from Qamardin Karez town (Zhob, Balochistan) that were intended to disrupt upcoming Muharram processions.

Property destruction: In September, Akazai tribal men burned down around 3 dozen houses and a mosque of rival Gujjar tribe in Torghar (Balakot, Mansehra, KP) over a land dispute. 25 men were later arrested.

ASSOC_ACTOR_1: BLA: Baloch Liberation Army; BRA: Baloch Republican Army; LeB: Lashkar-e-Balochistan
NOTES: Agreement: On Sep 18, 265 militants, including commanders, from the BLA, BRA, LeB, and other groups surrendered to security forces in Quetta city (Balochistan).

ACTOR1: Police Forces of Pakistan (2018-) Khasadar Force
NOTES: Arrests: On Sep 21, Khasadar forces rounded up 35 tribesmen, including Afridi men, from the Ali Masjid area (Jamrud, Khyber, KP) without court order or explanation.

Arrests: On Sep 21, PPP former senator and leader Syed Faisal Raza Abidi was arrested by policy in Islamabad city for anti-terrorism charges after he used inappropriate and harsh words against a Chief Justice.
On Oct 4, police raided a music party of transgender peoples in Charsadda tehsil area (KP), detained people without reason, took their belongings, and teased them.

Arrests: On Oct 5, police and the National Accountability Bureau arrested PML-N President and Leader of the Opposition in the National Assembly, Shehbaz Sharif, in Lahore (UC unknown; Punjab) for his role in the Ashiana Iqbal Housing Scheme.
Non-violent activity: Before or on Oct 6, unidentified assailants attacked the residence of the leader of the Jeay Sindh Tehreek. No reported casualties, no further information reported.
Arrests: Prior to Oct 12, a PML-N leader claimed that police had raided and arrested 35 party workers in Gulberg town (Lahore, Punjab) in advance of the by-elections [on Oct 14].

Arrests: On Oct 12, Federal Investigation Agency (FIA) officers arrested well-known social activist of PTM, Gulalai Ismail, at the international airport (Attock, Punjab) upon her arrival from London for participating in a PTM jalsa in Swabi n Aug 12.
Agreement: On Oct 29, the former general secretary of banned JSMM, Ghulam Shabbir Mallah, wanted for 16 crimes, surrendered himself to the Hyderabad police in Hyderabadh city (Sindh).
Security measures: On Oct 31, police imposed Section 144 across Punjab, Sindh, and Balochistan provinces until Nov 10. It bars the gathering of more than 4 people and pillion riding.
Security measures: On Oct 31, police imposed Section 144 across Punjab, Sindh, and Balochistan provinces until Nov 10. It bars the gathering of more than 4 people and pillion riding.
Security measures: On Oct 31, police imposed Section 144 across Punjab, Sindh, and Balochistan provinces until Nov 10. It bars the gathering of more than 4 people and pillion riding.

Arrests: Islamabad police cracked down on demonstrators following 3 days (Oct 31-Nov 2) of violent demonstration against the acquittal of Christian woman Aasia Bibi from blasphemy charges. As reported on Nov 6, FIRs were registered against 700 people, over 100 people were arrested, and 26 were remanded.

Arrests: Punjab police registered FIRs against thousands and arrested hundreds of people, including TLP activists, in the 3 days of protesting as well as the days following protests against the acquittal of of Christian woman Aasia Bibi from blasphemy charges. FIR nominations: 2500 in Gujranwala, 500 in Lahore, 300 in Sheikhupura, 200 in Okara, 110 in Jumber, 42 in Toba Tek Singh, 348 in Phul Nagar, 250-300 in Sargodha, 120 in Taxila, 142 in Chakri and Gujar Khan. Arrests: 1800 total, 170 in Sheikhupura, 110 in Hafizabad, 80 in Adiala, 44 in Sahiwal, 18 in Lahore, 5 in Rawalpindia, 5 in Nankana Sahib, 34 in Chiniot, 3 dozen in Faisalabad, 15 in Kasur, 15 in Kahuta, dozens in Nawabshah, others in Gujranwala and Rawalpindi.
Arrests: On Nov 10, police forces raided the home of a senior Urdu daily journalist, Nasrullah Khan Chaudhry, and arrested him in Karachi city (Sindh).

It is unclear what particular area is supposed to fall under the IS structure but attacks claimed in the IS statement where conducted in Balochistan province.

On June 12, district administration imposed a curfew beginning from the night of June 12 in the areas from Shna Khawra to Khar Kamar to carryout search operation against suspected militants owing to recent attacks on security personnel in North Waziristan district (Miranshah, North Waziristan).
