NOTES: On June 14, NAB put PPP leader and former MNA Faryal Talpur under house arrest at Zardari House in Islamabad city (Islamabad, Federal Capital Territory) in connection with a money laundering case.

ASSOC_ACTOR_2: PTI: Pakistan Tehreek-i-Insaf; Government of Pakistan (2018-)
NOTES: On June 14, NAB arrested PTI leader and Punjab's Provincial Minister for Forestry, Wildlife and Fisheries Sibtian Khan from Lahore city (Lahore, Punjab) over corruption charges.

ACTOR1: Police Forces of Pakistan (2018-) Counter Terrorism Department
NOTES: On June 19, CTD officials recovered concealed explosive materials including 37 mortar shells and 20 arms during an intelligence based raid in Mattani area (Peshawar, KP).

ACTOR1: Police Forces of Pakistan (2018-) Counter Terrorism Department
NOTES: On June 25, CTD personnel defused detonation materials after recovering 530 kilogram explosive material and four detonators during a raid at a house near Mosque Abu Hurera in Jauharabad town (Khushab, Punjab). A suspected militant was also arrested during the raid.

ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Police Forces of Pakistan (2018-) Balochistan Levies
NOTES: On 25 June 2019, Levies and security forces claimed they seized a large number of ammunition including anti-tank mines, hand grenades, SMGs and RPG7 rounds and other arms during an intelligence based raid in Mawand tehsil (tehsil hq coded) (Kohlu, Balochistan).

On June 27, police forces arrested South Waziristan District President and Shakai Tehsil President of ANP from their election office in Wana town (South Waziristan, KP) accusing them of taking out a political rally despite the imposed of section 144 prohibiting any rally or protests.

ASSOC_ACTOR_2: PML-N: Pakistan Muslim League-Nawaz; Government of Pakistan (2018-)
NOTES: On July 1, Anti-Narcotics Force (ANF) arrested PML-N's Punjab President and MNA Rana Sanaullah from Sukheki area (Hafizabad, Punjab) on the Islamabad-Lahore motorway over possession of a narcotics.

ASSOC_ACTOR_2: PML-N: Pakistan Muslim League-Nawaz; Former Government of Pakistan (2018-)
NOTES: On July 2, police arrested a PML-N leader and former MPA Shaikh Aijaz from his residence in the Satyana Road locality in Faisalabad city (Faisalabad, Punjab) continuing allegedly a pre-emptive strategy to forestall the PML-N's protest in the wake of arrest of PML-N leader and former Punjab Law Minister Rana Sanaullah Khan. Police have arrested around 24 PML-N activists since Rana Sanaullah Khan's arrest.

ACTOR1: Police Forces of Pakistan (2018-) Counter Terrorism Department
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Police Forces of Pakistan (2018-) Bomb Disposal Squad
NOTES: On July 4, BDS defused a bomb placed by suspected BRA Baggi Commander Group militants on railway tracks near Rajanpur city (Rajanpur, Punjab). Later, CTD reported that it had arrested five suspected BRA militants from Giamal locality of Rajanpur city over the incident and recovered explosives and ammunitions from their possession.

On July 6, police reportedly detained dozens of local leaders and workers of the PML-N in Mandi Bahauddin city (Mandi Bahauddin, Punjab) in an alleged crackdown on the PML-N workers on the eve of a rally planned in Mandi Bahauddin.

ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Police Forces of Pakistan (2018-) Bomb Disposal Squad
NOTES: On July 15, Shabqadar police along with BDS personnel recovered 1,600 explosive sticks, 20kg of explosives and 50 safety fuses from a deserted marble factory in Khwaja Was locality of Shabqadar tehsil (Charsadda, KP).

ACTOR1: Police Forces of Pakistan (2018-) Counter Terrorism Department
NOTES: On July 17, CTD officials from Punjab arrested JuD chief Hafiz Saeed on charges of terrorism financing, while he was traveling from Lahore to Gujranwala city (Gujranwala, Punjab).
On July 17, security forces (assumed police) recovered huge cache of arms and ammunition in Orakzai district.

On July 18, a NAB team arrested former Prime Minister and PML-N leader Shahid Khaqan Abbasi from Thokar Niaz Baig interchange in Iqbal town (Lahore, Punjab) over his alleged role in misuse of authority during awarding of an liquefied natural gas (LNG) import contract.

ACTOR1: Police Forces of Pakistan (2018-) Bomb Disposal Squad
NOTES: On July 30, BDS personnel defused a grenade hurled at a filling station near Kohat Adda in Peshawar city (Peshawar, KP). Unidentified attackers earlier hurled the grenade at the filling station but it did not explode.

ACTOR1: Police Forces of Pakistan (2018-) Bomb Disposal Squad
NOTES: On August 3, BDS personnel defused explosives planted on a railway track targeting the Bolan Mail in Kachhi (previously known as Bolan) district (hq coded) (Kachhi, Balochistan).

ACTOR1: Police Forces of Pakistan (2018-) Balochistan Levies
NOTES: As reported on August 6, Balochistan Levies recovered a large cache of explosives from Shamsar and Peer Koh area (Dera Bugti, Balochistan).

On August 7, the National Security Committee's meeting in Islamabad city (Islamabad, Federal Capital Territory) decided to recall Pakistan's Ambassador from New Delhi and expel the Indian Ambassador, and suspend trade ties with India.

On August 8, National Accountability Bureau (NAB) arrested the PML-N Vice President Maryam Nawaz and her cousin from Kot Lakhpat Jail in Gulberg town (Lahore, Punjab) in connection to an alleged corruption case.
A few days before August 13, police detained an active female leader of PML-N in Mingora town (Swat, KP) for allegedly raising slogans against the Pakistan Army during a protest demonstration.

On August 17, District Administration of North Waziristan issued a notification in Miranshah city (North Waziristan, KP) imposing a complete ban on the entry of non-locals to the district, in order to maintain peace in the region.

ACTOR1: Police Forces of Pakistan (2018-) Bomb Disposal Squad
NOTES: On August 17, security forces (assumed BDS) defused a bomb on Wana-Kari Kot road near FC camp in Wana town (South Waziristan, KP).

ACTOR1: Police Forces of Pakistan (2018-) Counter Terrorism Department
NOTES: On August 20, Sindh's CTD claimed to have arrested three suspected Lashkar-e-Jhangvi militants including a ringleader of the group from Hub River Road in Baldia town (Karachi, Sindh) while they were attempting to enter Karachi. CTD claimed they recovered arms and ammunition from the suspects and that they were planning to carry out major sectarian attacks in Karachi.

ACTOR1: Police Forces of Pakistan (2018-) Central Investigating Agency
NOTES: On August 22, the FIA claimed to have arrested a person with suspected links to Afghan and Indian secret agencies from Torkham border (Khyber, KP). FIA claimed that the suspect had established a group called Pakhtun Liberation Army and was involved in inciting violence against security forces.

On September 3, police personnel seized a huge cache of weapons including rocket launchers and IEDs during an intelligence based raid at a house in Muhammad Khawaja village (Hangu, KP). Three suspects were also arrested in the raid.

ACTOR2: Police Forces of Pakistan (2018-) Pakistan Rangers
NOTES: On September 6, 16 BLA militants surrendered their weapons and abandoned their armed struggle against the state at the Rangers headquarters in Larkana city (Larkana, Sindh).

ACTOR1: Police Forces of Pakistan (2018-) Counter Terrorism Department
NOTES: As reported on September 10, CTD personnel recovered explosive materials and parts of improvised explosive devices and arrested two suspected TTP militants in an intelligence-based operation in Gujranwala city (Gujranwala, Punjab). The suspects were allegedly planning to attack security personnel in Gujranwala.

ACTOR1: Police Forces of Pakistan (2018-) Counter Terrorism Department
NOTES: As reported on September 12, CTD officials recovered two hand grenades, one IED and a nine-kilogram bomb during an intelligence based operation in Shahi Kot area of Malakand PA district (Malakand PA, KP). Two suspected militants were also arrested during the operation. Some sources reported that the recovery of explosives and arrest were made in Nakamai area of Upper Dir district.

ACTOR1: Police Forces of Pakistan (2018-) Bomb Disposal Squad
NOTES: On September 13, on a tip off from locals, BDS of Bajaur Levies force recovered and defused number of remote-controlled bombs (IEDs) and several hand grenades from Inzari locality (Bajaur, KP).

ACTOR1: Police Forces of Pakistan (2018-) Counter Terrorism Department
NOTES: On September 13, CTD officials intercepted and arrested three suspected BRA militants during an intelligence-based operation in Mouza Chak Suri of Rajanpur district (Rajanpur, Punjab) while they were reportedly attempting to plant a bomb on the Sui Gas pipeline. The CTD officials also recovered 1.3 kg explosive material, electric detonator, remote-control device, a battery and cash from the suspects.

ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Police Forces of Pakistan (2018-) Khasadar Force
NOTES: As reported on September 14, acting on a tip-off, police and Khasadar personnel recovered 60 mortar shells concealed underground from Jamrud tehsil (Khyber, KP).

On September 16, police recovered huge cache of arms and ammunition from an abandoned car parked on Adiala road near Gulshan-e-Iqbal bus stop in Rawalpindi city (Rawalpindi, Punjab). Two suspects were also arrested during the raid.

ASSOC_ACTOR_2: PPP: Pakistan Peoples Party; Government of Pakistan (2018-)
NOTES: On September 18, joint team of NAB and police arrested a senior PPP leader and current MNA in a case regarding his alleged assets beyond means, from Islamabad city (Islamabad, Federal Capital Territory). The leader is also a former leader of the opposition in the National Assembly.

ACTOR1: Police Forces of Pakistan (2018-) Bomb Disposal Squad
NOTES: On September 20, BDS personnel defused a 10 kg IED planted at a roadside in the jurisdiction of Gomal University Police Station in Dera Ismail Khan city (Dera Ismail Khan, KP). Security forces suspect the IED was planted to target them.

ACTOR1: Police Forces of Pakistan (2018-) Balochistan Levies
NOTES: As reported on September 22, Balochistan Levies personnel recovered huge quantity of arms and ammunitions including 52 suicide jackets and arrested an Iranian national from a residential house in Pakistan-Iran border city of Taftan (Chagai, Balochistan).

On September 22, police recovered a huge amount of explosives, arms and ammunition in two different intelligence-based operations in Dera Ismail Khan city (Dera Ismail Khan, KP). Police recovered more than 20 kgs of explosives, including IEDs and hand grenades from the basement of a house in Himmat village locality of the city. In the second operation more than 30 kgs of explosives were recovered near Zafarabad locality of the city.

ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Police Forces of Pakistan (2018-) Frontier Corps
NOTES: As reported on September 27, police and FC personnel recovered a cache of arms including 10 rocket shells and two IEDs, during an intelligence based operation from a compound in Jangrai area in Bajaur district (KP).
On October 11, on a tip-off police recovered huge cache of arms and ammunition from the house of a MQM-L activists in Camp No. 2 locality of Nawabshah city (Shaheed Benazirabad, Sindh).

On October 16, police registered a case against 55-65 students and leaders of student unions and arrested more than 36 of them in Karachi city (Karachi, Sindh) for allegedly holding the Vice Chancellor of Federal Urdu University of Arts, Science and Technology (FUUAST) hostage and assaulting him.
On October 27, an unknown group burned down a medicine shop owned by a local JUI-F activist and religious leader in Jehangirabad locality of Khar town (Bajaur, KP).

On October 27, police arrested the District Amir and central leader of JUI-F from E-11-3, Masjid-e-Tuba locality in Islamabad city (Islamabad, Federal Capital Territory) on allegations of issuing inflammatory statements against the national institutions. The arrest comes on the same day JUI-F began their 'Azadi March' (Freedom March) protest campaign against the federal government from Karachi.

On November 30, a former student, chairman of Punjab University's Pakhtun Council and one of the leaders of Student Solidarity March conducted in Lahore was reportedly arrested by police personnel on charges of sedition from Punjab University in Iqbal town (Lahore, Punjab). Earlier his disappearance was reported as an abduction by unidentified persons.

ACTOR1: Police Forces of Pakistan (2018-) Bomb Disposal Squad
NOTES: On December 1, BDS personnel defused an explosive device planted at a bus terminal near a madrassa in Hindikhel of Janikhel tehsil (Bannu, KP).

On December 4, police arrested a female Afghan national and suspected would be suicide bomber along with heavy explosive materials from Peshawar city (Peshawar, KP). Eight others, reportedly Afghan nationals, including family members of the suspect were arrested.

As reported on December 15, customs seized a huge cache of arms, over 200 sophisticated guns of different specifications including Tomahawk, Maverick, KRAL (A-12) and Zirve and magazines during inspection of an empty truck coming from Afghanistan at Torkham customs station.

ASSOC_ACTOR_2: Former Government of Pakistan (2018-); Former Military Forces of Pakistan (2018-); APML: All Pakistan Muslim League
NOTES: On December 17, a three member special court including Chief Justice of the Peshawar High Court handed former Pakistan President and military ruler General (retd) Pervez Musharraf death sentence in high treason case in Islamabad city (Islamabad, Federal Capital Territory).
As reported on 21 Dec, military forces of Pakistan have deployed tanks along the LoC along with an increase in troop numbers.

ACTOR1: Police Forces of Pakistan (2018-) Pakistan Rangers
ACTOR2: AQIS: Al Qaeda in the Indian Subcontinent
NOTES: On 26 December, Rangers in a raid in Gujranwala city (Punjab) recovered a large quantity of media equipment, funds for militant financing, suicide jackets, explosives and deadly arms and arrested five AQIS militants.
On 21 Jan, police defused 26 landmines planted in a Government college in Khar tehsil (Bajaur district, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa).

ASSOC_ACTOR_2: PTM: Pashtun Protection Movement; Pashtun Ethnic Group (Pakistan)
NOTES: On January 27, police arrested human rights defender and Chairman of PTM Manzoor Pashteen along with nine others from PTM in Peshawar city (Peshawar, KP) on allegations of 'criminal conspiracy and sedition'.
Assumed on 30 Jan, Pakistan army allegedly engaged in property destruction in Washuk area (Balochistan).
Assumed on 31 Jan, Pakistan army allegedly engaged in property destruction in Washuk area (Balochistan).

On Feb 2, police conducted a raid at a house in Dastagir area of Gulberg town (Karachi City, Sindh), recovering explosive material and sophisticated arms. Police recovered nine RPG rockets, 60 hand grenades, 10 detonators, mortar shells, 38 SMGs and satellite telephone dumped in the house.

ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Baloch Ethnic Militia (Pakistan)
NOTES: On 5 March 2020, unknown gunmen attacked an oil and gas installation in Kahan town (Kohlu district, Balochistan). While no one claimed responsibility for the attack armed Baloch militants have in the past targeted oil and gas companies in Balochistan.

ACTOR1: Police Forces of Pakistan (2018-) Counter Terrorism Department
NOTES: On 24 March 2020, Counter Terrorism Department (CTD), arrested five militants and recovered two remote control bombs from their possession in Multan city (Multan, Punjab).

ACTOR1: Police Forces of Pakistan (2018-) Counter Terrorism Department
NOTES: On 25 March 2020, CTD during raid at Rojhan town (Rajanpur district, Punjab) arrested five Baloch militants and recovered seven kg explosive material, detonators, safety fuses, prima cord, and two Kalashnikov rifles and bullets.
On 28 March 2020, police arrested seven men for violating the restrictions during the lockdown for coronavirus in Larkana city (Larkana, Sindh).
On 17 May 2020, BLA militants set fire to Pakistan Army supplies seized from a truck and detained a truck driver and his associate at Nowano area of Buleda tehsil (Kech, Balochistan).
On 27 May 2020, Pakistan forces claimed they shot down an Indian 'spy' drone over Rakh Chikri town (Haveli district, AJK).

Around 3 June 2020 (as reported), suspected Islamists vandalised Buddhist carvings from 800 AD in Chilas area (Gilgit-Baltistan). The incident came to light after locals posted images of the vandalism on social media.

On 13 June 2020, a group of 5 to 6 Muslim men armed with guns, shouted hate speech at Christians and set a church on fire and broke down the outer wall and the cross of Trinity Pentecostal Church in Kala Shah Kaku town (Sheikhupura, Punjab).
On 2 July 2020, it was reported that military forces of Pakistan moved two divisions of almost 20000 troops into AJK and Gilgit areas.
On 2 July 2020, it was reported that military forces of Pakistan moved two divisions of almost 20000 troops into AJK and Gilgit areas.
On 20 July 2020, military forces of Pakistan detained all men at Malagzi and Pirjan Goth village in Jahao area of Awaran district (Balochistan) after conducting an operation in the area.
On 4 August 2020, Pakistan released a new political map claiming Indian administered territories of Junagadh, Sir Creek and Manavadar.

ASSOC_ACTOR_2: Police Forces of India (2014-) Border Security Force
NOTES: On 9 September 2020, Pakistan military intercepted and shot down an Indian drone in operating across the LoC in Chakothi sector area (Hattian Bala, AJK).

ACTOR1: Police Forces of Pakistan (2018-) Bomb Disposal Squad
NOTES: On 30 September 2020, police bomb disposal squad defused three bombs planted by an unidentified group on a roadside in Lal Qila town (Lower Dir, KPK).

On 6 October 2020, a phone tower, owned by a private phone company, was destroyed by militants (suspected TTP) using explosives in Maidan area (Lower Dir, KPK). No one was injured in the attack. 2 days prior to the attack, TTP posters were found throughout the area, warning locals not to cooperate with the government.

ACTOR1: Police Forces of Pakistan (2018-) Bomb Disposal Squad
NOTES: On 2 November 2020, the Bomb Disposal Squad defused an anti-tank mine in Zafarwal city (Narowal, Punjab) planted by an unidentified group.

Arrests: On 13 November 2020, police forces arrested 30 activists of TLP from Attock city (Attock, Punjab) in order to prevent them from participating in a protest march against the publication of blasphemous sketches in France and demanding removal of French Ambassador from Pakistan.

Arrests: On 13 November 2020, police forces arrested 30 activists of TLP from Chakwal city (Chakwal, Punjab) in order to prevent them from participating in a protest march against the publication of blasphemous sketches in France and demanding removal of French Ambassador from Pakistan.

Arrests: On 13 November 2020, police forces arrested 60 activists of TLP from Rawalpindi city (Rawalpindi, Punjab) in order to prevent them from participating in a protest march against the publication of blasphemous sketches in France and demanding removal of French Ambassador from Pakistan.

On 20 November 2020, police forces arrested the leader of TAJK - Hafiz Muhammad Saeed - from Lahore city (Lahore, Punjab) after the court announced 10.5 years imprisonment on terror financing charges.

On 21 November 2020, an unidentified politically backed land mafia demolished the newly constructed building of Union Council Chaubara (Chaubara, Layyah) to grab the commercial land. Investigation is under way.

On 28 November 2020, police forces arrested at least 40 activists of PDM from Bahawalpur district (Bahawalpur, Punjab) to stop them from participating in an upcoming anti-government demonstration scheduled in Multan.

ACTOR1: Police Forces of Pakistan (2018-) Bomb Disposal Squad
NOTES: On 15 December 2020, the bomb disposal squad defused a remote controlled explosive planted by an unidentified group near Bilawal Chowrangi area in Karachi city (Karachi City, Sindh).

ACTOR1: Police Forces of Pakistan (2018-) Frontier Corps
NOTES: On 15 December 2020, police forces of Pakistan defused a bomb at Karachi-Clifton town (Sindh) planted on the car of a Chinese restaurant owner.

ACTOR1: Police Forces of Pakistan (2018-) Counter Terrorism Department
NOTES: On 3 January 2021, CTD arrested a top leader of LeT in Lahore city (Lahore, Punjab) who was in charge of financing terrorism activities. He was arrested following an intelligence based operation.

On 12 January 2021, police forces seized a large cache of arms and ammunition outside the session court in Lahore city (Lahore, Punjab). The cache belonged to unidentified assailants and seven people were arrested in connection to the incident.

On 13 January 2021, police forces allegedly broke in to the house of a PML-N leader at Lahore-Cantonment (Lahore, Punjab) and resorted to aerial firing. Valuables were damaged but no injuries were reported in the incident.
On 18 January 2021, military forces of Pakistan launched an operation in Gorkop area of Kech district coded at Kech city (Balochistan). They set houses on fire during the operation.

On 8 February 2021, Punjab police arrested the president of Pakistan Kissan Itehad in Lahore city (Lahore, Punjab) for leading a protest 3-months ago which led to the death of a farmer following a clash with police.

Property destruction: On 17 February 2021, BLF militants targeted a mobile tower of a Chinese company in Dasht (Kech) tehsil (Kech district, Balochistan). No casualties were inflicted in the incident.

ACTOR1: Police Forces of Pakistan (2018-) Counter Terrorism Department
NOTES: On 24 February 2021, CTD personnel defused an IED planted by unidentified assailants along a railway road in Rawalpindi city (Rawalpindi, Punjab).

ACTOR2: Police Forces of Pakistan (2018-) Bomb Disposal Squad
NOTES: On 15 March 2021, Bomb Disposal Squad defused an anti-tank IED in Pasrur tehsil (Pasrur, Sialkot) planted by unidentified assailants. Police claimed that the IED was made in India.
Looting: On 17 March 2021, military forces of Pakistan conducted an operation in Jahoo town (Awaran district, Balochistan) during which they allegedly engaged in looting from the civilian population.
On 21 March 2021, police forces seized a huge cache of arms and ammunition from unidentified assailants at Tarraki toll plaza in Sohawa town (Sohawa, Jhelum) during routine police patrol.
Property destruction: On 25 March 2021, BLF militants torched a cellular tower in Ball Nagor area of Dasht (Kech) tehsil (Kech district, Balochistan).

On 26 March 2021, unidentified armed group set on fire 28 coal mines in Khost and Talib areas coded at Khost city (Harnai district, Balochistan). Initially responsibility for the attack was claimed in the name of BLA but this was later denied by BLA. No casualties were inflicted in the attack.

On 29 March 2021, unidentified armed group set on fire coal mine in Quetta city (Balochistan). Initially responsibility for the attack was claimed in the name of BLA but this was later denied by BLA. No casualties were inflicted in the attack.
On 3 April 2021, BLF militants burnt down a mobile tower that belonged to a Chinese company located at Dasht town (Kech district, Balochistan). No casualties were inflicted in the attack.

On 12 April 2021, police forces arrested the chief of TLP from Lahore city (Lahore, Punjab). The leader had issued a video calling TLP to hold countrywide demonstrations in the coming days demanding expulsion of French ambassador over blasphemous caricatures, as per the agreement signed between the TLP and government few months ago.

On 12 April 2021, police forces arrested at least 100 activists of TLP from various parts of Rawalpindi district (Rawalpindi, Punjab) for causing damage to public property in earlier countrywide demonstrations demanding the release of TLP chief and demanding expulsion of French ambassador over blasphemous caricatures.

On 12 April 2021, police forces arrested 42 activists of TLP from various parts of Chakwal district (Chakwal, Punjab) for causing damage to public property in earlier countrywide demonstrations demanding the release of TLP chief and demanding expulsion of French ambassador over blasphemous caricatures.

On 14 April 2021, police forces arrested at least 28 activists of TLP from various parts of Bahawalpur city (Bahawalpur, Punjab) for causing damage to public property in earlier countrywide demonstrations demanding the release of TLP chief and demanding expulsion of French ambassador over blasphemous caricatures.

On 15 April 2021, after the approval of the PM and the Federal Cabinet in Islamabad city (Islamabad, Federal Capital Territory), the government of Pakistan banned Tehreek-e-Labbaik Pakistan and declared it a proscribed organization.

On 15 April 2021, police forces arrested at least 200 activists of TLP from various parts of Kasur city (Kasur, Punjab) for causing damage to public property in earlier countrywide demonstrations demanding the release of TLP chief and demanding expulsion of French ambassador over blasphemous caricatures.

On 17 April 2021, police forces arrested at least 60 activists of TLP from Attock district (Attock, Punjab) on charges of participating in earlier countrywide demonstrations against the arrest of TLP chief.
On 27 April 2021, members of the Salarzai Qaumi Lashkar (an organized group/peace committee) set fire to the house of a man for shooting at a prayer leader in Salarzai tehsil (Bajaur, KPK).
On 28 April 2021, UBA militants attacked and burnt down a cellular tower in Kalat district (Balochistan). No casualties were inflicted in the incident.
On 3 May 2021, police forces arrested 131 people from Shakargarah tehsil (Narowal, Punjab) for violating the coronavirus SOPs.

Movement of forces: On 5 June 2021, a large number of Pakistani troops moved into the Buzgar area and started a large scale operation in Buzgar, Alik Sar, Sirki Kach, Khargat and Gadaang and adjoining areas [coded to district hq Dhadar city] (Kachhi district, Balochistan).
Defusal: On 14 July 2021, police defused a bomb planted by unidentified armed group in Muddi-Kulachi road in Dera Ismail Khan city (DI, KPK).
Property destruction: On 20 July 2021, BLA militants attacked a gas extraction set up allegedly run by Pakistan military in Kohlu district (Balochistan). No casualties were inflicted in the attack.

ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Police Forces of Pakistan (2018-) Balochistan Levies; Police Forces of Pakistan (2018-) Frontier Corps; Militia (Pro-Government); Police Forces of Pakistan (2018-) Pakistan Rangers
NOTES: Movement of forces: Around 24 July 2021 (as reported), military forces of Pakistan were moved to front line positions on the Pakistan-Afghanistan border while pro-state militia, Rangers, Levies and FC forces were withdrawn from the border patrolling duties coded at Islamabad city (FCT).
Around 7 August 2021 (as reported), police forces arrested 52 people from Bhong town (Sadiqabad, Rahim Yar Khan), for their alleged involvement in the attack on a Hindu temple.

ACTOR1: Police Forces of Pakistan (2018-) Bomb Disposal Squad
NOTES: Defusal: On 2 September 2021, BDS police defused a grenade planted by unidentified assailants at the judges' entrance gate at Judicial complex in Lahore - Cantonment (Lahore Cantt, Punjab). The incident is yet under investigation.

Property destruction: On 13 October 2021, BLF militants set on fire equipment belonging to a military construction company at Shand and Dar-e-Cham areas in Mand tehsil (Kech district, Balochistan) working to set up fence on the border with Iran.

Arrests: On 21 October 2021, at least 40 activists of TLP were arrested by police forces from various areas of Lahore city (Lahore, Punjab), ahead of their long march to Islamabad, demanding release of their party chief.

On 9 November 2021, a temporary cease-fire between the Pakistani government and the TTP was announced in a statement in Islamabad. The ceasefire will remain in place until December 9 during which both sides are expected to form a committee to continue the peace talks. The Taliban government in Afghanistan helped facilitate the ceasefire.
On 19 November 2021, as part of an agreement between the government and TLP, chief of TLP was released from jail in Lahore city (Lahore, Punjab), after months long detention.
